Terminate_-_Site_exists.description: Terminate the Logic App as the Group was found in the recycle bin. Group/Team creation will fail otherwise.

Check_if_SharePoint_site_exists.description: Check if the SharePoint site backing the team exists by executing the CheckSiteExists logic app.

Check_if_member_does_not_already_exist_a.description: Check if member is not added to the team at this stage or this will fail.

Remove_template_team_owners.description: When cloning teams, the owners of the source team will be cloned. We need to remove these owners.

Parse_create_team_JSON.description: Ought to check template operation is also equal to clone and handle if empty.

Wait_for_team_to_provision.description: Need to add a GET query to graph here to check team provisioning was successful.

Check_for_members.description: Check if members were specified when the request was created. Need to pass a different body to the graph call if there are no members.

Create_group.description: V1.0 of Graph API requires that we create a group first then add a team to it.

Provision_Team_from_template.description: Provision team from a Microsoft out of the box template e.g. SmallBusiness, Department etc.

Check_template.description: Check if template id is standard or blank (provision an empty team) - use the 1.0 graph endpoints and create a group first. Otherwise use the beta graph endpoints to provision an out of the box template.

Check_template_type.description: Check if the template is a first party (out of the box) template. If false, assume custom template and clone the team matching the specified template id.

Get_Client_ID.description: Get Azure ad app client id from key vault.

Get_Client_Secret.description: Get Azure ad app secret from key vault.

Append_Owners_to_Members_variable.description: Due to a bug when provisioning Teams via the MS Graph (owners cannot create Planner plans), owners must be added as members first.

body.content:
Welcome to your new Team

This team was created by the Request-a-Team app.

Your team is now ready for use, you can now start adding Members, Owners, posting channel messages and lots more.

For helpful tips on getting started with Microsoft Teams please visit the help center .

body.Body:
Team reated

Microsoft Teams Request
Team Created - @{triggerBody()?['Title']}

Your Team has been created and is now ready for use.

Click here to access it.

Enjoy collaborating!
body.Subject: Request-a-Team - Team Created
